metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9670 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An uninitialized stack variable vulnerability in load_tic_series() in set.c in gnuplot 5.2.rc1 allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault and Memory Corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact when a victim opens a specially crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnuplot - 5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
gnuplot-data - 5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
gnuplot-nox - 5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
gnuplot-qt - 5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
gnuplot-x11 - 5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> This CVE is specifically for the incr_token variable in load_tic_series()

criterions.comment: gnuplot package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.2+dfsg1-2ubuntu1').
